description:
A classic neighborhood dive bar in the center of the Mission near the 24th St Bart station with cheap drinks, and never too crowded on weekend nights.

Bathrooms are pretty dirty, but the bartenders are friendly and the overall vibe of the bar is unpretentious and laid back. It's cash only, so bring a twenty and you'll be set for the night with beers around $4 and cocktails for $6-$7 each.
author: Kedar V.

description:
*cash only 

meh. Definitely a dive bar. Bathrooms are gross but if you're stopping for a quick drink I'd recommend it. Drinks were cheap $6 .. average beer on tap.
author: Genaro L.

description:
I miss working in this vicinity, this was my go to for my post work whiskey double (don't tell my sponsor) 

Everyone here is great, at least two of them always remembered my albeit simple, drink. 

I love dive bars and it is exactly that!
author: Tanya T.

description:
Cheap beer, good times. A nice dingy bar with a pool table. It's really close to the 24th St BART station which is also a nice convenience.

I wouldn't personally make a trip solely to hang out here, but whenever I'm in the mission I tend to end up here since it's pretty uncontroversial and serves as a nice place to chill before going somewhere else (or grabbing a burrito and going home). Fun for all the family.

Men's bathroom is a bit grim and they're cash only, but it fits with the overall aesthetic.
author: Joe B.

description:
Chilled at this little bar with a friend who I haven't seen in a while (like almost a year), and a co-worker. It was a pretty cool lowkey hang out place. Lights are low, they have this cathode-tube TV with the curved glass and everything that accepts cash money for video games. I seriously thought it was a small casino machine or something that I could like....win something in, but literally it was just like an arcade / video game.

It's in a good spot, pretty close to the 24th st bart station and there's an el farrolito nearby and cool. But anyways nothing too special.
author: Willy X.

description: Little to say and little to complain about as long as your main purpose is getting cheap drinks.  It's dark, unpretentious, and cash only.  No frills, no food, but the bartender was friendly.  I loved that I could carry on a conversation in here without shouting, unlike most of the hipster bars!
author: Sheri W.

description: I always hit up mission bar on the way home from work or meet up with friends for a quick drink. Fair prices. Cash only fun people and a pool table. What more can I girl want. Good beers on draft and soft lighting :)
author: Lisa O.

description:
Unpretentious bar in the mission with cheap and good selections of beer on tap. Need I say more? If you're like me, you'll become a regular because...

A) Drinks in SF are overpriced
B) You're not into the "scene" or hipster spots all over the city 
C) You love the mission 

Get cheap drinks here with good bartenders, the end.
author: Salim Z.

description: Dude working the door was completely rude and cold. When I asked if he needed to see my ID, he said 'go.' Hire nice people
author: Adam H.

description:
This place is kind of small. There is the bar and some tables, but not much standing room. The cocktails were fine.

The bartender was nice and took care of us right away.
author: Richa N.

description: I like this place. So far it's the only bar I've found that has erotic photo hunt in the Bay Area. It's the kind with the old dome front tv though so it's a little hard to play. They also have a pool table with a board and friendly competitors, a clean bathroom, and cheap drinks. There are a few booths along the side and a large bar. Last time I was in someone was having their birthday party there!
author: Kaia V.

description: Excellent dive bar, great beer selection. Rock bottom prices. Staff was nice as well. Would come back for sure and spend more time.
author: Jonah K.

description: Dive bar in the mission with pretty damn inexpensive drinks. It is a comfortable and welcoming enough atmosphere that you don't feel like you are invading regulars territory. It's a great unpretentious place to hang out and grab a cheap beer! Harder and harder to find in SF anymore.
author: Steven B.

description: Thumbs down to some unfortunate racial/ gender profiling here. I've been coming here for the past 7 years with no issue btw but the last hour has forced me to rethink all of my experiences. Apologies to all the great people that work here but insulting and demeaning a woman of color on zero basis is unacceptable. I hope you get it together again and remember how to respect people.
author: Anastasia V.

description:
Solid mission dive.  No frills, pool table, place to sit, cold beer.

When I was in last the bartender was making chili dogs and handing them out for free. Some of the best chili I have ever had too.

Don't bring your MacBooks tech-bros.
author: Kyle S.

description:
I'm a big fan of Mission Bar. I'd been looking for a while for a good dive bar with cheap drinks and that real dive-y feel.

This review gets 5 stars because it is good at the following:

Notes: Cash Only, Jukebox, 2 small TVs, $3 domestic tap beers and wells in happy hour, $4 imported tap beers in happy hour, Pool table, no kitchen

What this is: Dive bar with that dive bar feel, great for cheap drinks, usually pretty quiet, legitimately cheap, like (less than) $4 beers and spirits to match, dark, grubby, friendly staff

What this isn't: A place to go for dinner, a place to watch 'the game', a bar full of hipsters, well lit

I probably wouldn't bring a date here, but would definitely be a good place for a drink after work, or a few cheap beers with a group of mates.
author: Brett E.

description: The atmosphere was comfortable. I prefer dive bars to more dance club places, so keep that in mind! Friends and I were able to mingle, get well priced drinks (cash only) and have a good time.  Next time I am in the Mission, I will come back.
author: Ashley W.

description: Tight but cozy, jointy feel, well stocked bar, strong enough drinks, no complaints. Handled a big group of us with 0 problem. Bit loud, but that might actually have been us.
author: Dave H.

description: No pretense. No BS. No nonsense. What else could you ask for in a dive bar? The Mission Bar is pretty central to the Mission, and is a great spot to stop in for a stiff drink. Bartenders are friendly and quick - again, what more could you ask for in a dive? Come in, have a stiff drink, and shoot some pool or just relax - you won't be disappointed.
author: Jeff G.

description:
Cash only!

Pool table!

(Usually) plenty of seating!

Friendly ID check and barkeeps!

Fair pours and good drinks!

Wallet friendly!

Happy juke box!

***Entertaining naughty "spot the difference" game, fun for all!***
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
I'm going to keep this review as simple as the place.
-Cheap
-Clean
-Dark
-Divey
-Great
author: Zorin D.

description:
Cheap happy hour and a pool table. The bartender was real nice and gave my my 3/4 cup of Radeberger when the keg kicked. Hooray! Freeeee beeeeer.

But yeah, cool bar. No frills. No problem.
author: Misha T.

description: I like this bar. Its a good place to stop off for a no nonsense drink. Me and a friend got a rum and coke and a beer for $8. Its not fancy but it does the trick when your in between bars or tacos. I like that it isn't some bourgie bar where a can of hipster Bud costs $5. The only downside is its cash only, but carrying cash is kind of a rule in the city, even if the hipsters don't get that.
author: Thomas J.

description:
Cash only. Be nice to the bartender, you will be rewarded handsomely. ;-) 

But for real, this spot was a great find! Real low-key, divey (dare I say, local?) bar.  This spot was a great little stop on our night out in SF.  The drinks were strong and the spot was pretty empty except for some folks playing pool in the back and a few barstools/tables occupied (of which there are not many).  The drinks were tasty (and very affordable considering the locale) and the bartender was attentive and moderately friendly.  I will bookmark and be back next time I am in The Bay!
author: Alexandra P.

description:
My friend is a homegirl lives in the neighborhood all her life so surprisingly I went there for the first time with her and I've lived here since 1984!

The bartenders were very warm and friendly the drinks were reasonably priced seven dollars for a glass of red wine that's A good deal for San Francisco!

I was feeling the love so I bought one of their T-shirts a white tank top I really like it it's good so I expect to be there again keep on grooving.

Although yes it is deep in the heart of millionaires row  techies you make a zillion dollars could you please wear some more Betabrand disco mirror ensembles please bring some sparkly spangly stuff back to the city your 100 shades of gray make me want to drink more.
author: SF T.

description:
There's almost always a seat here, and I have a hearty appreciation for their surprisingly delicious manhattans. I'm always more comfortable in a dive bar than a fancy bar, and thankfully that also means the drinks are cheaper and the crowd generally keeps to themselves without much fuss. I haven't seen a popped collar here, though I do see a lot of plaid (it *is* the mission) and the occasional tough guy dudes who've been coming to this bar since before it was this bar.

Overall: Simple, good drinks, no frills-- doesn't promise any either-- a decent jukebox and just the right amount of light to ignore the (probably) gross floor.
author: Krista L.

description: stay away dickbags, this bar is not for the faint of heart. Real peeps, good drinks. Ross n Co. kick ass. If you're looking for fancy keep looking. If you like complaining or wear shoes that cost more than my rent, fuck off. This is my bar n I love it
author: Kevin W.

description:
Not sure who enjoys being mad-dogged while they try to order a drink, but my guess is not many...

I get it...you came from Ohio or New Jersey or LA six months before your clientele, but your job still requires you to 'not' pick fights with customers...just a guess.
author: Alex S.

description:
San Francisco has a lot of pseudo-dive bars, and while I wouldn't say this is a real dive bar it comes much closer than most of them. The drinks are a great deal. It was very surprising to see good liquors like Stoli and Makers for $5. Bartenders were friendly enough and didn't skimp on the pours.

Even though it was a busy night the pool table remained vacant for a good portion of the time. They also have very favorable rules posted above the table. No doubles. What a relief. Playing doubles is the worst.
author: Michael S.

description:
How do you not stop by this quick stop drinkery...?  They have a sign outside that says "BAR."

Guinness bar finder verified they should have ingredients for car bombs.

Crazy lady picking fights with random people outside of the bar was pacified by 5-0 just in time for our arrival.  The Mission is a lively place.

I love dive bars.
author: Kat C.

description:
Oh, Mission Bar. You fickle friend. Great divey bar to duck into for sure. Cheap drinks, never over crowded. Sometimes there's a seat to be had, sometimes not. Watch out for the folks playing pool, and protect your drink from errant pool cues. 

They have some larger booths towards the front that are awesome if you can snag one. A decent place for large groups. No-nonsense bartenders, just the way I like 'em.

The good: cheap drinks, no frills. 
The bad: cash only. Make it rain.
author: Amanda B.

description: Strong drinks for a good price! Icame here with some friends around Halloween, and this place had a ton of sppoky heads on hook and a manikin dressed like a mad scientist. Anyways... We were able to get booth seat and talked and drank and played songs on the jukebox before goign to a roofftop bar down the street. Good times.
author: Aaron S.

description: Really enjoyed this place , one of my favorite little joints of the night , but one down fall, the men's restroom was completely disgusting, the smell was awful and it wasn't jam packed busy to where there was no time To clean up , other than that , price and vibes were nice
author: Anthony M.

description: Another solid dive bar option in the neighborhood.   Happy hour till 8pm.  Cold beer, strong drinks, and plenty of seating.  Bar tenders are friendly and happy to chat.  I look forward to returning.  Subtract one star for being cash only.
author: Nick G.

description:
This is the prototypical dive bar in the Mission. It's cash only, a decent selection of beers, and a full liquor selection. Prices are reasonable, and if you're nice to the bartenders you'll almost always get good service.

Mission Bar is dark, a little dingy, and draws a mixed crowd. Probably mostly locals to the neighborhood, but even if you're just visiting Mission Street it's a good bet. They have a couple TVs usually showing sports, but it's not over the top and certainly not distracting. 

I often end up here mid-way through a night out in the 'hood. Look for the big red-on-black sign that just says "BAR". You really can't go wrong!
author: Zach M.

description:
Great spot. 

Drinks are cheap. They have happy hour until 8 which means you can get drinks for 3$. You can also get tecate for 3$ all night long. 

The place is only one block from Bart, mission and 24th. On the heart of the mission district, this place must be a stop if you want to immerse yourself in the real mission experience.

There is a pool table at the end of the bar.

Bartenders are very attentive and friendly.
author: Alex R.

description:
This place hit all my spots:
Cute bouncers --check!
Cute bartenders (male and female)-- check!
Stiff, affordable drinks, and close to an ATM so I could adhere to the cash only policy-- check!
Jukebox-- check!
Casual, hip vibe-- check!
author: Janette W.

description: Just about what I'd hope for from a Mission dive bar, a dying breed indeed. You'll find great, affordable selections of beer on tap (starting at $3 until 7pm), with convenience to public transit. It even has ample seating, as well as a pool table in back. Two small TVs.
author: Randy M.

description:
It's sort of appropriate in a meta way that they named this place 'Mission Bar', because I've been wracking my brain for the last ten minutes trying to think of *anything* positive or negative that made this place stand out from any other dive bar in the Mission. 

And then it hit me.

Mission Bar is the perfect microcosm of the entire neighborhood's watering hole scene.

It's a dark, dive bar on Mission serving local-ish beer and mid-shelf liquor. Cash only. Old-school punk-ish rock on the sound system. A standard selection on tap. Not that clean, but not what you'd call dirty. Mostly white hipster crowd, but grungy-hipster not pretentious-hipster.

Thus, in lieu of anything unique about it to spotlight...they named it 'Mission Bar'.

The owners of this place are post-modern geniuses.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Great place to go. I read reviews on here so I expected the difficult bartender situation, but the whole place was lively and I had a great time.

I will definitely be going back. 

Also, as a big plus the happy hour prices were amazing! Definitely go check it out! You leave at the end of the night feeling like you got a great steal.
author: Jennifer S. C.

description:
The bartender who works here on Tuesdays for happy hour, should pay a bit more attention to MALE customers who are eager to buy lots of booze and leave big tips...instead, he pays an awful lot of attention to FEMALE customers, while ignoring the guy clients.

Does this guy come to work to flirt, or to make money for the owners?

I'll take my money elsewhere!

If I want to be served by lame, immature, suburban bartenders, I'd go drinking in Walnut Creek.
author: Matt B.

description: Great prices.  Friendly service.  Excellent selection.  What more do you need in a bar.
author: Greta R.

description: Best place on earth. Best Jamo pours in the city. Last week the bouncer told Drake he couldn't come in.
author: Brendan M.

description:
Monday - Friday Happy Hour 3:00- 8:00 p.m.

$3.00 Stella & Radeberger
$2.50 Anchor Steam, Sierra Nevada, Paulaner, Fat Tire
$2.00 PBR
$1.00 Off Well Drinks

Cheap Booze - CHECK
Pool Table - CHECK
Jukebox - CHECK
A block away BART - CHECK
Cool local dive bar - CHECK
Friendly bar staff - CHECK
Unpretentious crowd - CHECK
El Farolito  just around the corner - MF CHECK!
author: Ed V.

description: Cannot beat the beer prices of Mission Bar, especially in San Francisco. Beers on draft can be had for as cheap as $3 here and from previous experience, it's way too easy to get a good buzz for less than ten bucks. It has a dive bar feel to it, with leather booths and stools scattered around, but that's part of it's charm. And no better place to satisfy your drunchies craving than El Farolito, which is conveniently located just a few blocks away!
author: Heesun L.

description:
This was are 3rd Stop after the YEE Ed Lover and I stopped here for a few Big Papa IPAs .Mission Bar is a No Frills Dive Bar . Jukebox was going pretty cool. A little Bar Pool table and some very basic restrooms 
without door locks lol. We had a very leggy and cute Brunette Bar Mistress serving us. Ed Lover had me laughing my ass off as he had a good buzz on an was getting a little Slap Happy.
author: Eugene L.

description: Great near-dive bar.   Prices are right!   Late night rum & cranberry $4.00.  $1.00 grat for the quick, friendly bartender so leave a five or a buck.  Stop in after work!
author: Joshua C.

description:
Sometimes you just want to kick open the saloon doors and saddle up with your spurs for a stiff drink. You don't care what the place looks like, just as long as there's a solid article of clothing between your skin and the leftover blood and grime of the place.

Unfortunately, this isn't the Wild West, and the only place where a cowboy might feel appropriate also plays techno music for dudes in assless chaps (you go, guy--more power to you). 

Mission Bar is the modern saloon: unpretentious, cheap, dark and spacious. While there's no blood here (probably), the no-nonsense bartenders will certainly make drinks stiff and at prices pushing the frontiers of affordability. 

Happy hour specials include $4 cocktails (including manhattans, though for some reason I was also charged $5 at one point), and beer and well drinks can be had for less. Sink into your drink and manifest that destiny.
author: Keane L.

description: One of the few bars I would frequent for the past few years. Convenient location. Decently sized tables/booths for big groups. Attic club is still my favorite (RIP) but I got no beef with Mission bar and would dread seeing it change or disappear.
author: Henry T.

description:
So, I went to a birthday event, and somehow ended up doing a mini-bar crawl (Lone Palm and Doc's Clock were the others) and tacos run (Taqueria Cancun). Epic win FTW! Use it as a template.

This bar has everything a bar should have, right down to the nitty gritty. It encapsulates whatever you think a "Mission dive bar" is in your mind. So, everything good and bad about bars, it's all in here. Should visit at least once, just so can say have been to a Mission dive bar.

Milestone: the 1400th "Useful" vote's review...I think.
author: Peter L.

description:
This place is awesome!  The bar is pretty big, and they have a nice selection of beers on tap.  Happy hour during the week goes until 8pm, and that means $3 wells or drafts, which is amazing anywhere in SF.

What really made this place great was the people.  Five minutes after arriving I get into a friendly argument over Duke vs. UNC, apparently the bartender and a group of his buddies there were all UNC fans, so I quickly became known as "F*ck you Duke!"  I spent the next couple hours chatting it up with these guys about everything from medieval stories to the sexual habits of the disabled.   This place has warmed my Blue Devil heart, and I look forward to the next time I can go back, after earning the affectionate title "F*ck you Duke Dave"

Cash Only
author: Dave S.

description:
New York style! Kicken jukebox! Radeberger! 
Mag recommends!
author: Mag N.

description:
It's a dive. 
It's close to BART
It's got cheap drinks
It's got a pool table
It's a dive.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Hey Bartender, why you so grumpy?  I thought you were going to punch me out any second.  Scary.  

Either way, Mr. Grumps pours the strongest drinks.  My little whiskey ginger about knocked me sideways.  Perfect for a cheap date situation.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
Coming in here at the tail end of a bar-hopping spree, I have vague fuzzy recollections of this place, but I do remember two things: 1) the bartender was extremely nice and fun and 2) they were still serving drinks after other bars we'd passed by were closing up!  Score!

It's divey, they don't really have a menu of drinks so just pick your favourite beer, cocktail or shooter, and have a fun time hanging out with friends and chatting it up. 

It was definitely an alright place to end our night out!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
"Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven"  -Henry Ward Beecher 

I'm a hardcore atheist but I still like that quote.

Mission bar deserves five stars just for their annual charity auction benefiting The George Mark Children's House and Home Away From Homelessness; but they are a great bar for many other reasons as well. 

I recently had an event here for my dive bar group and Laura, the owner, was an "on the ball" professional. This is so refreshing for me because bar owners can be very frustrating people to deal with sometimes.

They have an excellent happy hour
From 3:00- 8:00
 
$3.50 Guinness 
$3.00 Stella & Radeberger 
$2.50 Anchor Steam, Sierra Nevada, Paulaner, Fat Tire 
$2.00 PBR

$1.00 Off Well Drinks: 
Which means $3.00 for basic mixed drinks (Vodka tonic etc), $3.50 for cocktails (lemon drops, Cosmo's and Margaritas) & $4.00 for martinis or Manhattans

I used to frequent Mission Bar years ago but for some reason I rarely seem to be able to get my friends out to the mission to drink anymore. Last night I met some people there and nothing has changed, even the beer prices. Beer for $2.50 till eight PM and only $3.50 after that, you just can't beat that.
author: Manny F.

description:
This is a pretty cool neighborhood dive bar. It's admittedly not worth traveling for; I live in the northeast pocket of the Mission and only find myself here when my friends who live on 24th are too lazy to hoof it halfway. 

Because there's nothing super special about it, my gut instinct is to throw down three stars. But, I've been so drunk here I've accidentally peed all over the floor of the women's bathroom... more than once... soooo... I feel like this extra star makes up for that? Yes? Hello?
author: Rebecca P.

description: Typical divey Mission bar. Good happy hour specials, strong well drinks, and a pool table in the back.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I don't watch horror movies.  I have enough problems with wacky dreams as it is to add night terrors from watching some stupid sorority girl get chopped up because she WENT IN THERE.  

The bathroom here reminds me of one of those dirty, creepy hallways in horror movies.  I half expected a hand to come reaching out  of the toilet to strangle me.  Thankfully, I was saved from any hands coming anywhere near my body parts.

There was nothing about this place that really stood out in my mind, except for the drunk tattooed "skateboarder" named, I believe, Chad.  The bartender was great, the drinks were cheap and good, and the jukebox has a lot of fun songs on it.  Anytime I can sing along to "Brandy" by The Looking Glass, I'm good.  

Again, another bar I'm going to have to check out again, although I think I'm going to avoid the bathroom next time.  I'd like to keep all my limbs attached for now.
author: Pam S.

description: My new fave dive bar. Strong cheap drinks!
author: Mao X.

description:
3 Dollar beers during happy hour! Half a block from my house! Cheap! 
A good crowd of regulars, local folks who are here often. Good jukebox, most of the bartenders are great.
Divey for sure, that's part of the charm. It's a little dark and damp, but by no means gross. Bathroom is clean enough! 
I once asked them to put on a Philadelphia Flyers game for me and they were happy to do it. There are always sports on the TVs and they are happy to oblige your requests. 

Only downside? Cash only. I love this place!
author: Kristin T.

description:
This place is run by a douche on a power trip. I frequent Mission Bar nearly weekly, yet when I'm passing by and in desperate need of a restroom, they wouldn't let me use it unless I bought something. 

From a business standpoint, how short sighted is that?! I bought a round of drinks here for friends the other night, but you can bet I'll never enter again. Was it worth hoarding those three sheets of toilet paper and a flush of the jon for the loss of a customer? Sure hope so, Mission Bar. Sure hope so.

Haven't been so incensed in a long while.
author: Elena d.

description:
Last friday was pretty epic.

83 Proof. 
Power Exchange.
Bacon Dog Cart.
Mission Bar.

I can't think of a greater way to end a night.

Janney and I ran in to use the bathroom--all that drinking and like HELL we were going to use the one at PE, and it was cramped but totally awesome when you need to hold yourself up because you can't walk in a straight line anymore. 

Then it was off to sit down again. I stumbled my way through the crowd, occasionally bumping into people I didn't know and finally found Matt H. For the next 20 minutes, Matt talks and talks and talks and talks and talks about something extremely sexual but of course I have no idea what it is because I'm trying not to puke all over the floor but all I hear is "sex" this and "sex" that so I just smiled politely and laughed when he would smirk at a comment he made. Then I asked to get a cab before I passed out on the floor because since the Bacon Dog Cart was next door and I was in a room full of Yelpers who the hell KNOWS what would have gone down.

I will definitely be back in this bar, as long as Matt H. is there talking dirty and I'm sober for at least HALF the conversation.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Came here as my last stop of the night after the Nom-Bay YEE (http://www.yelp.com/biz/city-by-the-nom-bay-elite-party-nombe-san-francisco#hrid:ntmDbg7AmUnpKz-7QuX-Lw) and Velvet Cantina (http://www.yelp.com/biz/velvet-cantina-san-francisco#hrid:QdOOkbRgUE9g1oz_RgPrxA).

Dive bar on Mission and 23rd w/ pool table.  As I was already feeling good when I arrived, it didn't take much before I was thinking it was time to call a ride and wait outside while getting some fresh air.  Thank you for coming to pick me up! =)

Now out of the limited I do remember about the place, it was fairly easy to find a stool seat at the bar, the music was playing, I wanted to play a game a pool, all were sociable, and the bar is kind of dimly lit.  But not so dark that I would have stumbled on my own feet on the way out! ;0)

I'm sure I'll visit again one day...
author: Ninja H.

description:
I'm not sure why, I've been in some sketchy places, and this one is high on that list.  Was it because this was my fourth bar of the night, (day?) at around 6pm and my intuition was running on extreme overboard.  Wandering the streets, we stopped in the Mission in between blocks to keep the buzz. Sat down at the end of the bar, and ordered a round. And then another.  And then one more before I realized that I had to pee, or pee my pants.  Looked around, to the right of me, and down a hall with no lights was a bathroom.  In those moments, I thought I was never coming out.  This was my last moment here on earth, sitting on an midget toilet in a dark bar, where no one will here me scream over the overbearing juke box down the long dark alley hall thing.

Whatever, SO SUE ME. I had a bad night.  It was probably the booze talking. I'm okay with that.
author: Madison B.

description:
Being slightly hipster-averse, I'm unfamiliar with the bar scene in the Mission. Polk Street and Lower Haight are my go to drinking locales. However, I need to broaden my horizons and give the Mission a chance. 

I was a little reluctant to try Mission Bar because of the reviews but I'm glad that I did. It's not quite as divey as I expected. Don't get me wrong, it's 100% divey but it's not as scary, dark or uninviting as I expected. The bartender, a large tatted up man, was VERY friendly and continually checked up on the customers. There was an eclectic mix of patrons but no drama, riff-raff around. There were even people studying at the bar.

Mission Bar wouldn't be my first option when drinking in the Mission but it's totally fine to drop in. Oh yeah, CHEAP DRINKS! $3 wells :)
author: Kiristen R.

description: I was walking by with my dog, really had to use the bathroom (during Carnaval parade) and I saw people with a dog inside already. So, I walked in and used the bathroom, which was very clean. Nobody said anything and nobody seemed to mind. So, I stayed and had a drink. The bartender was very nice and accommodating. My drink was not overpriced, and they let me sit in one of the booths with my dog. We really enjoyed the break from the crowds outside. I will return and try again!
author: Janette R.

description:
Laura if you're reading this, will you go out with me?

I went here recently for the first time and was lucky enough to accompany a regular who knows Laura (the owner) pretty well. She talked to us for a bit and the moment she described herself as an alpha male, she had my heart.

Aside from that, she makes a wonderful (strong) drink. The place itself is nice and laid back - there are booths all around and the bar itself is comfortable. There are also semi-pornographic Halloween decorations up right now.

I think I've made my case.
author: Aubrey O.

description:
(Pub Commute Stop 3)

So you need a place to round out your hipster's night out at The Attic, Latin American Club, and Doc's Clock?  Look no further than the Mission Bar.  It's sort of the Kirkland Signature of mission hipster bars (at least, I'm pretty sure it's hipster--it was nearly empty on Tuesday, so sort of hard to judge the crowd.)  Everything about it is a bit generic and/or prototypical, from the simple BAR sign to the decor that's essentially a toned-down average of the afore-mentioned 3 bars.  But that's not a bad thing--sometimes even hipsters need more drink, less 'tude.

Sadly, I have no tales of madness to compare to Ed's.  But the night is young...
author: Wes M.

description:
I love it as a marketer: A massive, well lit sign on the outside that says just one important word: Bar.

I love it as a fiscally responsible person: $8 for two whiskey sprites.

I love it as a whiskey sprite drinker: They were good. And stiff.

I don't love it the morning after.
author: Jason B.

description:
I broke a long-time rule and actually went to a DYL. Here. [This would be an odd story if the DYL was elsewhere, and I ended up reviewing this bar. Not that I haven't done similar things in the past. I just recognize that they're odd.] 

Usually, I'm totally cool with dive bars. Hell, at the bars in my hometown that I grew up drinking in, Bacardi was considered top shelf. I was at a bar two months ago where the bartender confessed that, in two years of working there, she'd never made a martini before. THAT'S a dive bar. There was, however, just something about this dive bar that I didn't like. I'm a Mission resident, and even I don't like the stretch of Mission that the bar sits on. The bar is narrow, dark, noisy, the bathroom walls appear to be on the verge of achieving sentience (you'll know when they do, because they'll start screaming). 

The drinks were cheap, and relatively strong. The pool table in the back runs true, and the cues were straight. If you don't believe me, you can ask the fellas my partner and I shellacked in a game of 8 ball. 

Overall, my impression was basically that I can think of a half-dozen bars in a 4-block radius that are as cheap (or close), cleaner (by far), and nicer in general. But then, I'm an alcoholic---no, wait, I'm a drunk. It means I don't have to go to meetings. Which, in turn, frees up more time for drinking.
author: Ben P.

description:
Need to get drunk on a budget? Come to Mission Bar during their Happy Hour and get a Manhattan! I was sipping whiskey (technically bourbon since they used Bulleit) like Peggy Olsen all night. I still can't believe how strong that drink was. That was pretty much all I needed for the night. 

I really appreciated that there was a TV and they had the Giants game on. Giants won 3-2 in 11 innings so I was glad I didn't have to miss that. 

There was a lively crowd and everyone I talked to was friendly and positive. This is definitely a place I would bring my out-of-town friends to when they come to visit.
author: Daisy S.

description: My favorite bar in SF. Brian (Thurs/Sat) is such a sweetheart and one of the best bartenders in the city. Friendly atmosphere, great prices, and great people. No douchebaggery allowed.
author: Da Wei S.

description:
They have sweet tea vodka! and they make John Daly's and serve em in glass jars! 

love love love em for that.
author: Antoinnae C.

description:
I came on Friday November 12th, 2011 around 10 PM - and was immediately greeted by a friendly barkeep. Got two drinks - Vanilla Vodka Soda and a Bulleit Rye for $10! Felt it was an absolute steal!

Overall the staff was friendly, bar wasn't too crowded and it was a great place to be at.
author: Brian D.

description: HEY!!!! HEY!!!!...YEA! YOU THERE! This bar is it, for one of the best dives in the mission Dist.  They have great happy hour specials....for people who use bart....it is literally a block away form the 24th & Mission exit. Cheap drinks...awesome staff...Only downfall to me personally as a pool player...they have only one pool table. But, that's no worries....it's not to long of a wait to play a game...sign ur name on the board and wait your turn. Mind you......if people in front of you are really drunk...their game may take a while. I have witnessed even one person lose their balance to shoot,lol. This is also a great place when you are hungover, and your friend from another district decides to come to the mission, and make you move ur ass. It's nice and dark inside...so while you are nursing that evil hangover from the night before...you can nurse it in the sanctity of a dark hole ;-).
author: Mr. Potato G.

description: Just a typical dive bar, and on a Friday night, it gets packeeeedddd.  My friend and I were nursing our beers as we felt other patrons eyeing our precious table.  The music was loud, and I think I'd be more into this place if I was already in the hammer zone, or came here for a more laid back happy hour. But, it is only a block away from BART, which is a plus..
author: Mel G.

description:
Good times at Mission Bar last night. Not so good times for me this morning :(  Reasons why I loved this bar and I hate myself today. 

1. It's dark inside. There is nothing worse that a bar that's bright as fuck.
2. The jukebox has some sweet sweet oldies to choose from. 
3. Patrons were friendly, chill,  and low key. 
4. Bartender (Justin) did a fantastic job of making sure we got pie eyed.
5. Dog friendly.
6. Got a pack of smokes and a falafel sandwich next door. (Them drunk munchies hit hard sometimes!)
7. Super close to BART.

I would definitely come back to Mission Bar. I got drunk, had a good time with friends, made good conversation with the bartender, got great service, good pours, and left happy.
author: Cheeks L.

description: After coming from Nap's down the street we ventured into this bar. Now, I've seen this bar since it's beginning but never ventured in. There were four of us and I must say the reception we received was very welcoming. The drinks were reasonable and good and strong. We had a great time. A place I'll definately go back to.
author: Googie G.

description: I had a fabulous time at Mission Bar on Friday night celebrating Tom R's birthday. The place was packed with more than a hundred people who were Tom's friends from one of the local Meet Up groups. This is a classic dive bar and the first I've been to in a long time. The environment was dark with a vertical layout that had small tables stacked on one side of the wall facing the bar and a good looking pool table in the very back. After being stuck in LAX with a prolonged flight delay, I managed to grab a chicken shawarma sandwich from the deli next door to complement a huge glass of hefeweizen followed by Tom's recommendation, anchor steam. The quality of the hefeweizen wasn't the best I've had, but the anchor steam was quite good. In addition to the friendly crowd, each glass was less than $3.00 and I had a wonderful time catching up with Tom and getting to know his friends. Although the line to play pool got really overwhelming in the end, the proximity to the 24th BART Station and extent that people were so friendly and approachable made the entire experience worthwhile. To add to the experience, the bartenders were laid back, friendly and very quick to respond. There was someone who brought her cute dog so it was nice to have her companion as well. I would love to come back again.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Every visit to Mission Bar ends in me seeing double. 

My five buck bourbon on the rocks overfloweth, surface tension holds 'em together. Round upon round of Tecates. The end of sessions leave me inebriated and my purse happy. That's hard to come by.

It's the kind of place that doesn't try, and admittedly, I enjoy a little bit of grime with my brews. Kick ass jukebox, pool table, erotic photohunt. The perfect trifecta. 

Yes, please.
author: Ligaya T.

description:
I went here for the first time last night and had a good time. Typical dive bar that could easily be passed on the street unnoticed. Dark and loud inside with relatively cheap drinks and a pool table in the back. 

Pro's - My $5 margarita was strong. Even though it's in the Mission, the place wasn't overrun with hipsters, at least when I happened to be there. I really appreciate a place that has a good amount of non-hipsters.  

Con's - Bartender who made my drink wasn't too friendly. It took a while for him to serve me and he wasn't even busy.
author: Gina G.

description:
Great bar. In fact, my new office bar.

They supposedly serve Pabst here, but on the night i went they were out. Hence, I can only give this place 4 stars. That's false advertising, people. You can't have a neon Pabst sign in your window and not provide the goods. To be fair, they were just sold out that day, but still ...

Anywho, this place is pretty cool. The motif is a black and red one, with linoleum tiled floors in said colors, and red walls upon which black tables, seats and booths lean. Pretty cool. Kind of dingy, a little sketchy, but not too bad.

There's a pool table in the back with the ever important red lights hanging over head. Love it. They have a somewhat orderly system to manage the games, too, with a chalk board on the rear wall.The table seems fairly level, and that's always nice. Also, and this is important, they have a KILLER juke box. That's right, the juke box will murder you ... with music. It's very well stocked, with a lot of tunes that are key for pool playing (read: Blues and Rock).

Bathrooms were a little sketch-ball, but not too bad. Kind of what you'd expect given the over all feel of the place.
author: Wes T.

description: Barman was attentive and friendly without being in-yer-face. Halloween severed heads dangling from the ceiling are AWESOME. Great bar.
author: Kate A.

description:
This place was your average bar. Drinks were mediocre. Nothing stood out though. 

Not a great place, but not bad either. I would still come back if I was in the area and wanted a drink
author: Lisa W.

description: Hairy dog bloody mary and a friendly bartender to take the pain away.
author: Laila F.

description:
This might be the least pretentious bar I've ever been to. 

Fantastic happy hour until 8pm, and juts simply a true dive in every sense of the word, doesn't try to pretend to be something else.
author: Mark A.

description:
First I was afraid, I was petrified, because of the scary people standing outside leering at me, but then I got carried away, by the awesome vibe inside... and I grew strong, and I learned how to jive! 

Fun, crowded, dive bar with affordable drinks! Be sure to snatch up the corner booth if you are going in a group.
author: Camie K.

description:
Came here last night after La Taqueria, and I'm glad we did! At least Mission Bar understands the recession we're in:

$2.50 Paulaner Hefeweizen (until 8pm)
$3.50 Fat Tires (wow! so reasonable - and I can support my home state)
$4 Stella's 

Friendly Bartenders and ample seating - I'm in!
author: Sally M.

description:
I was already out of it when my friend told me we were going to the "bar bar" for her birthday.  I thought she had turned Singaporean but she meant Mission Bar.  Same same but different.  She was the younger sister of a college pal and whenever I told a story, mentioned my younger sister or told people what my occupation was, her male friends would ask what year things had happened or how old my sister was.

I was confused about their interest but didn't think much of it until I realized they were trying to gauge my age and because I was friends with the birthday girl's older sister but Asian, they couldn't figure out how old I was.  Neener.

The bar itself was dark and dirty and drinks were delivered at a good pace.  Prices were very reasonable and the crowd went unnoticed.  All good things in a bar.
author: Seong P.

description:
Alright bar. Pool table. Cheap drinks. Lacking in character/personality if you ask me, but other than that I don't have any rants about it or anything.

3 stars being that I'm not necessarily a fan & it's definitely just not 5 star material.
author: Kai S.

description: I went here quite a bit in the past 3 years and loved it.  There's no other bar quite like this and the bartenders are friendly.  The shots of well vodka are cheap during the week and the people that drink here are nice.  I recommend this place for first dates :)
author: John A.

description:
A STRAIGHT BAR? Would I dare go the final frontier and head to a straight bar? This place is the typical Mission hipster, local crowd.

I did. It was nice. I bought my friend some drinks and the bartender kept serving me soda water. This cute straight boy wanted to buy me drinks, but the deal was over when I told him I was "T" before he had a drink. Next time, get to know the guy better why don't ya? But damn he was cute and PINOY.

He wanted me to stay longer. But I couldn't. I had to get home.
author: Lana P.

description: The most consistent dirt-cheap top-shelf manhattan in the Mission ($6 for a heavy pour of Maker's Mark or Bulleit). Mission Bar just keeps getting better every time I go back.
author: Aaron V.

description:
When we entered, I automatically remembered my college days of hanging out with too-cool scene kids and wishing I could blend in. 

This trip was part of a pub crawl, and most of the group was already in the back playing pool and hanging out when we arrived. I liked that we were able to easily find seating at the bar and a booth in the back, and that drinks were $4. The music was at a good volume, so no one was shouting over it to talk.

But why only 3 stars? Because it's a dive and I'm never a dive fan. So this place is OK but that's basically it.
author: Emilia S.

description: This is a no thrills, down and dirty mostly hipster free place to grab a drink while they are reprogramming your phone over at Verizon across the street
author: Jim B.

description:
ooh oh!! I was drunk with Lisa here! It was our third bar on girls night!

I remember liking it!
I can't wait to go back and write a REAL review!!!!
author: Jessica L.

description: It's just dark enough. There are TVs that are not imposing at all. Fantastic bartenders. Pool table and James Brown on the jukebox to boot.
author: Adam M.

description: on a Mission Sunday Happy Hour...literally on Mission in hidden hole in wall w/ pricing to keep my lush in slush rolling
author: Bryan G. W.

description:
I'm not sure how it is I never stumbled in here before I stumbled in here last night.  I had just eaten a bacon dog, and Joan Jett's cover of Crimson and Clover was blasting, and I was with a good friend, and the bar was uncrowded, and the floor is bare plywood, and there's a pool table in the back and a shot of Fernet with a ginger back never tasted so good.

I . . . I'm not such a sweet thing . . . I wanna do everything . . . what a beautiful feeling . . . crimson and clover . . . over and over . . . .
author: Joe C.

description:
An almost-last-call quick-stop at Mission Bar lead to me...

Almost passing out on my boyfriend's shoulder while sitting on the bar stool, holding my vodka soda, in mid-sentence about my dead father...

Then deciding that our drunk asses should stumble home and hang out on my back patio and enjoy the beautiful 2:00 AM weather...

Becoming suddenly responsible and closing the door so as NOT TO WAKE UP MY ROOMMATES. Who were NOT home. Because we left them at the bar. I think...

LOCKING MYSELF OUT. IN MY BACKYARD.

Not being able to determine a path OUT of the backyard...

Going upstairs and barging in on my neighbors' guys'-night-in Ski Patrol screening...

Drunkenly pontificating about how much Detroit sports rule with the one of them from Michigan. Even though I think he REALLY just wanted to watch Ski Patrol...

Stumbling downstairs and ringing my doorbell a million times so that my roommates who STILL WEREN'T HOME could NOT let me in...

Somehow stumbling to the bf's 'hood a mile away...

I THINK trying to buy more beer and condoms at Kansas Food Mart. Which was most definitely NOT OPEN (classy shit)...

Waking up the next morning still locked out...

With no jacket...

No phone...

AND A KILLER HANGOVER.

This place fxxxed me up.

Good dive bar.
author: Lisa T.

description:
This place has quickly become one of my favorite bars in the Mission. I can't believe that it took me a bunch of years in San Francisco to try this place out. 

The barmaids are sweet and remember me every time I come in, although it's really just been a handful of times thus far. The doorguy's always been pleasant every time I've gone, and I've never had to wait more than a couple of minutes for a drink, even on a packed Friday night. And this place is pretty local and charity-minded it seems. They were gearing up for a charity auction to be held there the last time I went in. 

The bathroom is pretty meh and it's one of those scary bathrooms where you're not sure if it locks and you can't sit close enough to the door whilst on the toilet to be able to hold onto the door to make sure you're not barged in on in a compromising situation. Yea, it's kind of scary, and I did barge in on someone once. Oops. 

And the piece de resistance? Shiloh the dog hangs out there. That's one darn cute dog.
author: Rachel F.

description:
Picture this: a big (huge, really), bucket glass filled with ice, a hearty pour of Maker's Mark, and a solid splash of ginger ale, delivered to you by a friendly, attentive bartender for all of $5.00... in San Francisco. On not only a *Saturday* night, but any night of the week. 

Mission Bar is almost too good to be true! Great drinks at an unbelievably reasonable price (shhhh!), really cool bar staff, interesting, diverse and friendly crowd, and a *kick-ass* rock 'n roll juke box. The bar stools are ample (which my booty appreciates), and if you're not one for bellying up to the bar, there are also tables and booths to cozy up in. 

I think they even have a pool table...

No attitude. No hipster bull. 
Just a great place to grab a (cheap) big-ass drink with your drunk-ass friends.
author: Tiffinie T.

description:
I don't know why it has taken me so long to review mission bar, but here goes. I've lived  in SF for about 15 months, and my friend Sabrina took me here my first week in the city. I've been about a dozen or so times since then, and have always had a great experience. I live about a 10 minute walk west of this place in between 23rd and 24th, and consider this my watering hole. 

The bar tenders I've met - Walter, Mia, and Laura are always friendly. It starts getting crowded after 9:30, it's always a mixed crowd, but I've never met anyone pretentious or douchey. Their pool table in the back is great, drinks are very reasonable (~$4 for a pint or mixed drink), and their jukebox is awesome.
author: Scott J.

description:
At the second bar of Christmas I bought myself for me:
One vodka Red Bull
One pint of PBR.
This bar is okay.
I've never had an engaging conversation here ever ever with people I don't know though.
Disinterest, for some reason reigns here.
So, a so-so bar as the name would suggest.
author: Theo R.

description:
This is the best bar with the best staff. Unpretentious, good fun! Strong, cheap drinks. Awesome jukebox! Been coming here for over 10 years, and will continue to be a loyal customer. 

Very fun decorations during Halloween. Gets crowded on the weekends after 10pm. But that's only because everyone has found out about this place- and keeps coming back! 

Walter G is the best here! His drinks have kept me coming back for all these years. Laura- the owner is awesome too!
author: Angela L.

description:
Welcome to Bar.  Have seat, order drink.
Chat to woman.  Laugh at jokes.  Tell story about stuff.
Relax with friend.
Order more drink.  Chew on cubes.
Go home or bring home to house.

Enjoy time.
author: Patrick A.

description:
The Mission Bar apparently has a broken fax machine and thus didn't get the memo from the Emperor of San Francisco that all bars have to be at least 80 percent full of Google dickheads and trust fund kids. Also, they charge reasonable prices for drinks, which is absolutely astounding considering this bar is on Mission Street. 

Also, and this is a major bonus, they don't have a tiny leather jacketed bouncer-ess that tried to fight me for smuggling out a beer like a certain other establishment next door who shall go unnamed.
author: Stan B.

description:
Back in my day...

...Bars didn't need no fancy names!  You're a bar in the Mission, on Mission St?  Then you're named Mission Bar!

...Places didn't need no fancy misleading signs.  Just a giant red "BAR" gets the message across!

...You didn't need some fancy electronic music playing gizmos!  You had a jukebox, with maybe 200 songs.  And you liked it!

...Beer was cheap!  You could get a PBR for $2!  You drank it and it made you feel like a man!

...Bar stools and booth chairs were old and cracked!  The decor was non-existent to falling apart!  But you didn't care.

...A game of pool costs $0.50 (but actually takes 4 quarters).

...There are only 2 TVs, standard def!  Playing whatever sports were on, so you didn't feel like an alcoholic!

...A bar was no frills, laid back; a great place to hang out.  You just go grab a booth with your friends.  Get some ridiculously cheap (and strong) drinks.  Just hang out and talk.

...A bar was supposed to be the kind of place to relax and meet up with your friends for no other purpose than you wanted to hang out with them.  No need to see or be seen.

...You had to walk to your local watering hole.  Uphill.  Both ways.  In the snow.  And you liked it!  Then  you died of cancer, like John Wayne!  A man's death!

OK, so maybe I'm not that old, and the last one isn't really true.  But Mission Bar is pretty awesome.  Don't come in expecting anything.  It's just hands down my favorite hang out in SF.
author: Zhi Q.

description:
It's really dark and everything is nice and cushy inside.  The drinks are strong and cheap.  
This is a great place to meet someone you might not want your other friends to know about.  Mainly because it's not a very popular bar and it's nice and dark inside.  I like the cushy booths.  The bar keeps are sweet.
author: amanda v.

description:
I can't remember how long I have been going to the Mission Bar. When I go there I usually end up not being able to remember how long I have been sitting at there.

This is a bar. That's it. There is nothing pretentious or uppity about this place. It is, hands down, my favorite place to drink in the city.
That's it is also next door, if you don't know.

I bring everyone I know to this bar. At least once.

Amazing pours.
Great bar staff.
One of the best jukeboxes in the city.
I can (almost) always find a seat at the bar.

The gritty feel of the neighborhood and the strong vibe of this place both act as natural filters, keeping lots of people away who may not be as comfortable here as they would be elsewhere. 

I can't stay away.
author: Jason S.

description:
Chances are your 1st two choices for the night failed if you end up here.  It's okay... drink from the tap of Lethe ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethe )

And enjoy yourself it's a friendly bar
author: jack w.

description:
This place is open early. They serve rummies. The frequently entertaining professional dipsomaniacs. Always a good sign.

There is even a little speakeasy bar in back that can be hired out for private joints. Exclusive, but still seasoned. Very nice.
author: Jeremy W.

description: I like to sit, drink, and talk to either nobody or my friend, without having bad music blaring at me. I can always get a seat, a shot, and a beer here. Thank you.
author: Raptor J.

description:
Spooky and suggestive halloween decorations? CHECK

SUPER CHEAP happy hour deals? CHECK

Good times? CHECK

Found this place on yelp.com, and was drawn to it for its happy hour special.

$2-$4 drinks. Can't get better than that!
author: Misha F.

description: one of my favorite dive bars in SF. Big bar. Bartenders pour a nice stiff drink and the prices are right! A great place to start or end a night out in the mission.
author: Sophie C.

description:
You gotta love a bar that has a sign that looks like a slot machine you might play.  We'll call it a cheap slot machine and each time you win.  You win a drink.

MIssion Bar is what I would define as one of those true locals bars.  There's booze, seats, juke box and pool table.  No gimmicks or TV to try to get randoms to come inside.  Hell, from the outside it actually looks like a place you'd rather not go into if you haven't been there before.  I will give them a pass on the awesome halloween decorations which apparently used to feature moving rats.

The bartenders have been cool.  If you give them attitude, they'll give you attitude.  If you come in relaxed, chill and jovial, they will be the same.

The beer selection is rather average with Radeberger being the most exciting thing available on tap but then it's hard to complain with the low prices on some of the beers.

The space is good too.  You can pack a good group of like 6 - 8 friends in here without it getting too awkward chatting and getting drinks.

Recommended.  I'm a fan of Sunday nights.
author: Steven R.

description: Small dive bar in the mission. Juke box has some old hits which aren't too bad but the place is full of dirty hippies n hipsters who need to shower and wash their hair. They also need new clothes or at the very least they can wash their clothes..
author: Rico G.

description:
Another great Mission Dive.  The sign out side reads "BAR" in big red letters.  

It has one of my favorite Juke Boxes in the city giving it extra added bonus points in terms of dive bars.  It also comes complete with a pool table, cheap drinks and your neighborhood alcoholic (or several of them) who look like they've spent their entire life sitting inside this bar.
author: Shayna N.

description:
Ok, being from New Orleans, I had my repetoire of bars set.  No fancy clubs or dance parties for me, usually just homey neighborhood Irish pubs and dirty dive holes.

Living in LA for the past three years shocked me into thinking California had no idea how to properly serve alcohol  (last call at 1:15 wtf? wtf is "last call" anyway?).

The Mission Bar has reaffirmed my faith in bars that close at (almost) 2 am.
Non-pretentious patrons and no nonsense bartenders.  Usually not too crowded until later, but then you're drunk anyway.

I don't know what people are complaining about the bathroom here, this place has damn near the cleanest men's room I've ever seen in a bar.  You could operate in that bitch.  It could use another urinal though, or perhaps a trough of sorts.  Maybe it's the ladies room that's just a poop-fest in there?

Yes the jukebox is really as bad-ass as everyone says it is.

Anyway, hipsters wouldn't like it, stay away.
author: Michael L.

description: Happy Hour til 8pm! That's the most generous HH I've seen anywhere. Casual crowd, doggy friendly, lots of seating. I'm usually camped out at the front table under the neon glow or warming up a stool. This is my go-to when I'm out and about and need to kick my feet up and have a drink. My only complaint is that they need more Scorpions in the jukebox.
author: Oz B.

description: Definitely what we were looking for on Saturday night. It had the awesome red sign that says BAR. We found a booth and worked on a few beers. The one pool table was being dominated by some scary broad. The juke box blasted out some solid oldies. The one interesting note was the urinal that had a lime in it. After a few uses without a flush it looked like a corona. Seriously. The drain hole in the floor next to the urinal must be inviting to drunks because it looked like it was being used for target practice. I would definitely come here again.
author: Ryan B.

description:
RATS! ....go and figure out. 
The soap in the bathroom was fantastic.
author: Dario B.

description:
They have the touchy porn game!  My friends and I stopped by for some low key drinks and hanging out.  The game kept freezing, but my super smart friend reached around, unplugged it briefly, and then it worked perfectly!

This is also the bar where I unsuccessfully (and stupidly) tried to argue Led Zep isn't the greatest rock band of all time.
author: Adrienne W.

description:
Look, right now I know this place is awesome, but I lack the ability to properly put it into words. That will have to come later. Just trust me, now that Treat Street is gone, this is the next best dive bar in the Mission. My hangover tomorrow will do nothing but prove it.
-----------------------
ahem, so, this place rocks because it has lots of big, comfortable booths covered with squeaky pleather, and even the little tables in the middle of the booths are pleather covered. their jukebox has plenty of good tunes, and it doesn't have the volume cranked up so loud that you can't hear what anyone around you is saying. the decor is basic, nothing too fancy. i believe they had a pool table. place was not too crowded but also not empty on a saturday night. very comfortable crowd, not too hip, not too yuppie. bartenders were friendly.  a very comfortable bar.
author: Tom H.

description:
I really like this bar. Went there with local friends and had a great night!

But have to complain about something someone already did here, they should accept alternate IDs. I'm from Brazil and the second time I went there my friend and me couldn't drink because she said our IDs wasn't ok and the ID must have a body description, Brazilian passport doesn't have it... we couldn't drink there that night. I felt really bad.

Could give 5 stars, but after the 'ID problem' I wont. Until they improve this failure.

Is a great place, has a pool table, cheap juke box and cheap beer! If you're local and have a local ID, you're ok. First night I went there the bartender was great.
author: Clarah G.

description:
The Mission Bar could almost be a 5-star party palace. Or it could be a 1-star pox on all of drinking humanity. Because the Mission Bar itself is a tabula rasa.

The room is a simple box, admirably low-lit but not stylishly dark (no suave candles, underlit bar top, or fancy fixtures to speak of). Drinks are absolutely affordable. There's a pool table. Some scruffy booths. Scuffed floor. Red walls. A decent jukebox.

All that is irrelevant, however, once people show up.

The crowd is what most immediately defines the Mission Bar. Located as it is --- right on Mission Street itself, within spitting distance of the 24th Street BART --- it seems to have no regular clientele of its own, simply whatever mass of beery bar-hoppers happens to be there when you arrive. This means you may have to fight off suburban jerkoffs drowning in perfume/cologne and clad in the latest mall fashion wack-cessories. Or maybe everyone will be sporting intentionally lopsided bangs and hipster-wave retro clothes from the Flashdance collection of 1983. Or, hell, maybe it will even be empty and quiet and you'll stare into your beer fizz and think, "Hey, I bet this place would be pretty cool if there were, y'know, anyone here."

That's the fate of the Mission Bar in the year 2007. Not a bad place. If you gather enough friends around you, it could easily be YOUR place. Dare to enter it alone and risk total alienation.

The sign outside simply says: BAR.

I think that may be the most accurate sign in San Francisco.
author: John G.

description:
Went after work on a Tuesday, and seeing as it was approx 6pm, it wasn't exactly hopping. there was a group of apparent regulars and me. I was one of two females, and easily the youngest person there by 15 years. 
Tattooed bartender was friendly enough, and rattled off the happy hour specials in a way that made me figure he knew i never came here. offered to have me try one of the beers I ordered before I had a full glass, I think because I look like a blonde bimbo who enjoys things like The Hills and the color pink. These things I do not enjoy. I enjoy beer, and I told him there was no point in having me try it, seeing as I would drink it all regardless. Had two beers, sat there staring into my beer just like everyone else did....kinda like the beer was a crystal ball and it would magically reveal our futures if we looked at it long enough.

I'll give it a star for the jukebox, but when no one had anything selected we all sat in silence. Maybe it wasnt a very talkative crowd? Maybe it's me? I don't know, but I wanted to love it and I didn't. I'll go back at a different time and update this if need be. But i did love the cheap beer and happy hour deals, so thanks guys. And to the tattooed b'tender, I hope your daughter's doing well, she sounds adorable and I hate babies.
author: Kristen H.

description: Ice-cold fantastic ales. Friendly dive-style service. No fecking about. Just fab.
author: Glen M.

description:
Great Local Bar

Great place to bring friends to just enjoy a few drinks, play pool in the back and just have a chill night.  Bartenders are friendly and this place is cheap.

$13 for Grey Goose Ginger & Belvedere Soda

Definitely a place I'll be hitting up again.
author: Po L.

description:
The only thing I regret about moving out of the Mission is the lack of proximity to the BAR. Nowadays it takes a bus ride and walking six blocks for me to get inappropriately smashed.

Here's to the wonderful owner (sorry doll, have known you for years, but I'm always too drunk to remember your name), the wonderful bouncer (ditto) and to Ross, who doesn't work there anymore.

Wonderfully stiff drinks. The right dive bar/non-hipster attitude. A decent pool table. Black leather booths that suck you in and won't let you go. A dog-friendly vibe.

Just be careful with what you touch in the bathroom so you don't end up with white residue on your hands - oh, and feel free to take this as a hint as to why some of the patrons are so talkative, or introverted. 

I love this place. Three shiny, bright, red neon letters that spell out one thing: HOME
author: Tatjana G.

description:
One of my favorite dive bars.  I love that the only sign is a bright red neon "BAR".

The service is always great - stiff drinks.  Good manhattens. Killer jukebox.  Icky bathrooms.

Most of the male bartenders are all burly-lookin' and you get the feeling that they might not be so friendly... But they all are.

A couple times I've been in on a weekend afternoon with a girlfriend and sat at the bar.  Good conversation with the bartender, followed by a free shot and a drink or two.

Good times. Good times.
author: cindy p.

description:
From what I can remember of this night, there was nothing bad to be said about this bar. It had a good mix of people, not as many douches as I have found in past mission area benders. It helped that I with a big group and got drunker than a bored surburban housewives at lunch (that really didn't work.) There were a couple of groups of attractive females, as well as an attractive group of small dogs...hmmm. 

Either way it was a good time and will hopefully find myself going back soon. 

Overall: Very decent bar that seems like it will a safe and solid pick in the future...Pool table as well

Value: Standard, although from one bartender I was charged $4 for a G&T and then $3.50 from another....meh

Note: I will give someone a dollar if they can tell me where I got one of the worst burritos of my life after as well.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Many of the other reviews refer to this place as a "locals bar" and it definitely seems that way. It's not as grimy as Delerium but its also a lot smaller. 

The best part though are the cushy booths.

Also, they played "Wanna Be Startin' Somethin'" 3 times without ever ONCE following it up with Rihanna.
author: Ali L.

description: This place is pretty cool. It was a low key night when I came in here, but I really liked the music, and the vibe here. Beers were cheap here, the drinks were strong. Wasn't as crazy crowded, or oddly dressed like the Phonebooth. And I can appreciate that.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Not only will they leave you alone while you eat your torta from La Altena and read the Sunday times you stole from your work building...

...but they'll serve you a $3.50 dirty martini -- a GOOD dirty martini at that -- and a $2 PBR while they do it.

Dinner and a buzz for $13 with tip (at both places).  That' s something.

Then maybe you and the barkeep will shoot the shit about something else -- cos it's hard to read Week in Review under 45 watt red lights w/out your eyes bleeding  -- while on the next stool over, the flannel-wearing guy checks something or other on his BlackBerry in between shots of Jack.

This is the Mission. This is 2008. This is it.
author: Chris R.

description: I've popped in here on occasion over the years and due to the fun times and decent pool table I'd be inclined to give this place four stars.  However, my recent early evening experience here after the Attic really grossed me out.  Total sausage fest in here and nobody was friendly...what an understatement.  I did not see even one female inside.  Bartender was cool though and made a strong drink.  Shot a couple games of pool, slammed my drink and got the h#ll out of Dodge.
author: Roy N.

description: Definitely pretty divey, but good for a somewhat large group of friends to all sit down and have some cheap drinks. The bartenders were nice and it never got too crowded which is nice when you're with a lot of people.
author: Casi C.

description:
Closed down Savanna Jazz, then closed down Mission Bar, so it was a good night.

I'm a big fan of bars with cheap pool, comfy booths, great jukeboxes, and inexpensive drinks.  Especially when they're two blocks from my friends' house.

Plus, it just has a big sign outside that says simply, "BAR."  That rules.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
when Dirty Thieves has yet to open, I am here.  They serve food evrey day. Ingenius!
Convenient, and "divey" enough.
author: Rick H.

description: Even on a Friday or Saturday night when this place has a bunch of people in it, you can still breathe!!  Unlike most bars, this one actually has space to enjoy your time there.  The drinks are good, not expensive, and not too hard to get on a busy night.  Considering the location, hipsters rule this place.... but that's far from a bad thing.  At least they don't glare at non-hipsters like they do at The Attic!
author: Laura P.

description: Great neighborhood bar!  I kinda disagree with calling this place a dive  -- a true dive should have a more threatening clientele -- but it has a pleasantly dark and dingy aesthetic you could call "divey."  Bartenders and clientele are non-pretentious, no-BS types.  Mission Bar is a place where you go to drink; it's not "sceney", and nobody trying to impress anybody.  I've gotten into decent conversations with random strangers, and that's usually a sign of a good place.  Good music, not too loud.  Mission Bar is a place I go back to.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
This is a really great bar. The it's dark, it has stiff drinks and is in a kind of shady part of town. But it's all good when you go inside. The people are cool and the music is loud. 

A place to be visited at least once after a long night of...whatever it is that you do.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Five stars for the memories I have of this bar.  

The bar is simple, no frills, great jukebox, pool table and booths.

I became a whiskey drinker here.
author: Jen I.

description:
I like this bar because it's not hip and not expensive.  And not even in a not-hip-so-it-is-hip way. It's just a bar with a mix of people from all walks of life.

It also has one of those small creepy SF bathrooms, you decide if that's a plus or minus. The woman's bathroom has the smallest sink that I have ever seen.
author: Ann C.

description:
The sign simply says "BAR". I love simplicity. And $2.50 happy hour beer on tap. Especially drawn into their special glasses (some pilsner that starts with an R and has a crown on its tap).

I just got home from (hel)L.A. Welcome home. :-)
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Edited again:  I moved BACK to the Mission.  Bubba is working Saturday afternoons, and he's pretty much awesome.  Go for the chili dogs!  

The bartenders here make this place.  They're all pretty much awesome people.  That said, there's not they can do to improve the Mission Bar.  It's a top place to go on a weekday afternoon.  Good, strong cheap booze, good jukebox, lots of great foot traffic outside, clean girls bathroom!

All in all, an awesome place to go to.  I don't think I've ever had a bad time here.
author: Meh M.

description:
Been here once. a friend suggested. The sign just says "Bar", i rolled my eyes and said "whatever another dump". 

Actually it was nice in a old school bar look kinda way. You can tell its been there for a while. The barkeep was kool. Striked up some conversation, made some good drinks and the best part they didn't mind i had my dog with me.
author: Alfredo N.

description:
I have a deep attraction for the Mission Bar.  It caters to everyone (even dogs) and is just a fantastic gem of a place.  

Whenever I'm in the Mission (which isn't nearly often enough) I have to come here.  Everyone is friendly, the drinks are strong (and cheap as hell), the jukebox is fabulous, and I don't know... it's just the best.

I LOVE YOU MISSION BAR!

(Beware the rats on the wall.  Not real, but creepy anyway.  Is that new?  I told you I don't come here enough)
author: Laura B.

description:
This isn't one of my favorite places to go, but I don't really have a reason to say so.  Other places somewhat nearby are Elbo Room and Delerium, but those places are WAY too crowded.

Mission Bar is almost refreshing. It's just a bar. Even its sign just says "BAR."
author: Amy Z.

description:
Very nice bar, the music is good and it's definetly a place to hang out.
Usually there are cool people, it's pretty easy to meet someone.
author: Steve E.

description:
So the sign just says "BAR" but thats ok with me.
The spot is pretty nice, and usually not noisy enough to bug me.
author: Tom S.

description:
Have to give this 5 stars....its definitely become a second living room... while that may sound sad to some, its really not! 

Great bar, "divey" if you will, but stocked with fine libations. Super friendly bar staff. Laura is the shit. so is Walter. 

Its cheap, its friendly. I'm there. So are my friends. You may even see a cutie lil doggy on the bar named Shiloh. What else could you possibly want in a bar? 
Check it out.. you won't be disappointed. Unless maybe, its Friday/Saturday night and the bridge and tunnel folks are in, but hey.. there's no escaping that in the Mission on the weekends! Have another Fernet...it will get better...
author: Samantha S.

description:
Nice dive bar to check out when you're not looking to do anything fancy on a Saturday night.  We stopped in to meet up with friends and enjoyed the low-lit dive feel that the bar gave off.  The booths are great, but there's a limited number and were all full (and stayed full) while we were there.

The beers are cheap - $3.50 for Anchor Steam - and the bartenders are nice.  Not super friendly, but nice and there when you need them. 

We were excited about the pool table in the back, but there were some real wing-nuts who guarded the table with their lives and wouldn't let anyone else play. But that's nothing against the bar - just the annoying people who happen to be there the same night as us.

One thing that's too bad is that there isn't a patio to step outside.  Personally, I like my beer accompanied with a cig or two.  You can always step out front, but what's the fun in that if your beer is still inside?
author: Amy J.

description:
So I used to go to BAR at least once or twice a week, sometimes 3-4 times per week, no joke. We went big most of the time - drinks were cheap and strong, you could usually get a table, etc. etc. Then, over time, we realized that while Walter the bouncer recognized us and made small talk, the owner (I forget her name) always acted like she'd never seen us before. We thought that was a little weird, and too cold. I mean... we might not be the coolest group of friends you've ever seen, but we always tip well and for christ's sake! we were there multiple times a week for months on end. 

Eventually, the thrill wore off and we headed to greener pastures. Still, it was good while it lasted.
author: Jen B.

description: My buddies and I had a good time grabbing a beer here last night. It's your typical dive bar...props for having PBR cans (make it tall boys and you can have a 5th star). It wasn't too crowded around 11 so getting a drink wasn't a problem. I'd definitely come back on another night out in the mission.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Friendly bartenders, above all, who were great to make conversation with and who were amazingly good humored about my indecisiveness - "I'll have a whiskey up ... no wait I lied, throw some rocks in there ... or, actually, yeah that's great thanks." Even topped off the glass after my bumbling modification. Lots of space. Very inexpensive to drink well liquor here all night - which was precisely what I was in the mood for.
author: Alex B.

description:
typical Mission, dirt cheap, literally! for both words.
At last somewhere happening on a Tuesday night in our lovely SF.
author: Damien J.

description: It's a bar.  It's in the mission.  At Christmastime they had a Santa sexing a barbie from behind up at the bar.  Hell yea.  Aside from that its pretty standard, the cocktails have booze, they're nice and reasonable, pricewise.
author: Emily T.

description: Just in case you forgot, this bar rocks! Best happy hour in town, friendly bartenders, great Jukebox, pool table and TVs with sports. Every time I go here I feel centered and my chi is at peace.
author: Corey V.

description: There is absolutely nothing I can say about Mission Bar that has not already been said.  Double the five stars, sprinkle the whole thing with gold, then double it again.
author: Chris C.

description:
What?

5 stars?

Yes. I am bestowing five delicious stars on this fine tippling establishment based on the sheer awesomeness of their Tuesday night special. FREE POOL & $1 PINTS OF PABST. Do the math, friends. You will have a shitty Wednesday, guaranteed. Beyond this nut-tingling deal, there are many other fine points of distinction to be made. The jukebox is top-notch. Appetite for Destruction, Surfer Rosa, Paranoid - all of these albums and more are collected in one device for your listening pleasure. There is ample seating throughout, and the bar itself is pleasingly long and easy to lean against. The pool situation is of an admirable quality - unless you are prone to blaming the table/cues for missed shots (Santos!) you should be relatively content. Apparently there is a secret little room in the back where unspeakably awesome things happen. I haven't been in it. So in summation: go to this bar on Tuesday nights.
author: Max H.

description: It's kind of like Doc's Clock, except with pool (not shuffle board) and flipped around, and smaller, and maybe not so bright.  (Right.  "Just like.")  But it's another good Mission bar.
author: Laurel B.

description: The doors have padding on them. So do the walls and the pillars in the middle of the bar. There are soft vinyl couches and even the tables are covered with slightly puffy vinyl. I want to believe that the owners of this bar were anticipating a lot of bar fights, but they probably just thought it was swank or they got a good deal on foam or something.
author: matthew r.

description: I have always called it "Bar-bar" or possibly "Babar" after the children's book Elephant King.  It's a dark cavernous place, and reminds me of a less upmarket Make Out Room.  Cheap Drinks, long hours, reasonably clean restrooms. Good place to duck in for a shot of Fernet at 11am while you wait for the 14.
author: Gustie L.

description: Cheap, dive-y, booths, good old timey jukebox, sane bartender. Ladies with metal in their faces. A good local bar in southern mission. I vaguely remember ordering a round of 4 drinks here and it came out to $9.50 and then stopping by el farolito to inhale a quesadilla on the way home.
author: Gabriel H.

description: The bouncer who is most often working here is rude and classless. I have never been kicked out of this bar or anything, but I hate it when alternate forms of ID like a foreign ID card or a passport are not accepted, and that has happened to people I have gone there with. Otherwise this place would get 3 stars, but it just happens to suck terribly because of the one weak link.
author: Skyler C.

description:
First off... the name of this place is The Bar Bar.  Coz of the sign, yo!  If it were the Mission Bar, then it would say as much on the sign, right?  But, the word on the street and the word on the sign, is "Bar."

Moving on.  I've never been in The Bar Bar at night.  Why?  Because the place is "night" itself.  Meaning, it is very dark in dis here bar.  

During the day, it is a perfect place to go if you are a vampire nursing a hangover and trying to get away from the piercing rays of the afternoon sun.

At night, it must be doubly dark.  And this block gives me a bad vibe at night so I stay away from it.  Something wicked this way comes... from Walgreens, perhaps.
