But, for alcoholic-slumped-at-the-bar-in-the-afternoon-style drinking, I cannot recommend it highly enough.
author: David M.

description: There has been many a night that I have ended up at BAR, lured in by their red lights,  cheap drinks (3.25 for a well drink)  and complete and utter lack of pretension.
author: Maria D.

description: I went here to meet a woman who answered my craigslist personal ad. She suggested the place. When I showed up on Friday at 9:00, it was empty except for the big barman and my date.  The ceiling was high, the bar was long, and it was dark in there. We drank anchor steam beer and told each other our life stories. The place might have filled up, I don't know.  We got loaded.  Later, we went over to the Dovre so we could smoke cigarettes. We drank more. Yadda, yadda, yadda, now I've got herpes. Thanks Mission Bar!
author: mark k.

description:
So i walk into this place because the Make-Out wasn't opened yet and read a few Yelp reviews. It's early Friday after work and no one around. Bartebder was pleasant guy, but I happened to be sitting next to one of the bar fly's. Happy hour prices made me happy. So I'm looking around and there is all these bags behind the bar. I'm told by friendly neighborhood bartender that there is an auction for George Mark Children's hospital that night. So i walk back to back. Wondered where pool table was. Items for auction. Snow board, 1/2 Mag of Mondavi chardoney, 40 of Chimay blue, PBR beech towl and flip flops. golf bags, SWAG, pool cue, either a picture of a pool table but i think the pool table itself. The item that caught my eye. My childhood bike, Lot30, a schwinn metalic purple with pearesent banana seat and sissy bar, high handle bars and curved front forks. One set more of forks in opposite direction = chopper.  
Bar Fly - he was cool. smart insightful and probably me in 20 years
BF - there are 5 things you need to know
me- um ok and we only get through 4
BF - have to have a good career path
me - :)
BF - need to have good financial path
me - ;)    i think mom must have called this dude
BF - you need a good woman
Me - :)   yep mom knows all and def called this guy
BF - you need a woman that will help career and emotional bath
Me - Can i get another beer please mr bartender
BF and I talk about living in south bay LA and places we hung out. I'm going home and Googling you. 

Guess what. Same places. yep - i just saw my future in 20 years unless i change it.
The place. I loved the padding on the pillars, covered in pleather along with the booths. A great "random" time after work
author: Mark A P.

description: Not much to say except that I have, on numerous occasions, arrived here intoxicated and left more intoxicated without breaking the bank. Never as crowded as other bars in the vicinity and a pretty chill crowd too. Bring a flashlight if you are afraid of the dark. The padded walls and surfaces remind me of work.
author: Autumn K.

description: Finally checked it out on a whim, and though it's dark and divey, it didn't look as bad as it does from the outside. Good for happy hour and cheap drinks (though my Guinness was a bit flat). I'd come back again, but never by myself. Mainly a bar for the locals who've lived here forever (think men over 40), and great for those looking for an alternative to the trendier bars in the vicinity.
author: Zell C.

description:
mission bar is one of those places you go to because its there. 

its not exciting but its a bar. and a decent one. and you can usually find a hot dog guy nearby.

definitely a good part of any mission bar crawl.
author: Britney K.

description: Local bar, cheap but good solid drinks (almost half price from what you would pay at Medjool.) Pretty laid back place with a pool table for a game or two. Wish they had the jukebox play more free music though...
author: T L.

description: Pool table in the back, standard bar with not alot of ambiance.  Juke box with some decent selections, 3 selections for a $1.  Drinks were strong and satisfying, not too pricey.  Staff is nice, bathroom is tiny, and semi-clean.  Worth a visit if you need some liquor before you go some place cooler and more hip.
author: Audra E.

description: This place kinda looks like a jail from the outside, but inside it's quite comfortable, they have big booths so great for large parties. The bartenders are really friendly, it doesn't seem to get to crowded so there is always a seat. Which is the most important thing for me at a bar, I hate standing around  drinking.
author: JIll H.

description:
What can I say about Mission Bar that hasn't already been said?  It's a great neighborhood dive with a completely unpretentious vibe, it's near El Farolito and it has quite possibly the best jukebox in the city.

Mission Bar just feels like home.
author: Alice T.

description: Cheep booze and good music. 5 out of 5 for Queens of the Stone Age factor. Very much a regulars bar, although there's plenty of love to go around. If you like Zeitgeist, Bender's, & Kilowatt, chances are you'll like it here too. Extra points for close proximity to El Farolito and Popeye's.
author: Dan M.

description: i've been to BAR a few times now and it's satisfied me everytime. after being dragged to that shithole Medjool down the street last night, this place was the perfect refuge to that ridiculous scene. just the place to have a drink with friends around patrons that can appreciate good drinks and attentive bartenders.
author: Art O.

description: According to a friend, this place can get congested on certain Saturday nights.  However, it was mostly unoccupied when I came by.  I didn't think it was that divey, but if you frequent venues that charge $20 cover, you may think it is.  Cheap drinks, a classic long bar layout, grimey rock 'n roll blaring from the jukebox, the lights throwing rouge on everything, and a hard-working bouncer who repeatedly barred a persistent drunk pugilist from entering made it a fitting place to chill with Comrades and plan the Revolution.
author: Momo R.

description: No frills, dark, hole-in-the-wall type of bar.  I ventured into this locale in hopes of partaking of happy-hour.  The happy hour is from 4-8, I believe.  When I saw the promo chalk board sitting outside and I verified with the barkeep that $2.50/special INCLUDED GUINNESS, I almost f-in fell over.  The way to my heart is through Guinness.  So, even though the women's bathroom was flooded at the time that I needed to use it and smelled foul....and the chairs were sorta sticky....and I wouldn't normally frequent a place on gritty, Mission Street...I think that BAR is a-ok.  B/c $2.50 Guinness on DRAFT, will always get my seal of approval.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
wonder if this bar was to move.... would they change their name too??

not sure how my girl friends and i ended up here but we did... i think after walking around the area trying to find a spot to go...
we didn't really stay for very long but it was nice that it wasn't so crowded and the people there seemed rather chill...
author: charlotte s.

description: I love this place.  I frequent this place because the Happy Hour is until 8 pm.  $2.50 drafts and $2.00 PBRs.  $3 well drinks, and depending on the bartender, you can get smashed with about two or three of those.  After Happy Hour beers are only $3.50 which is still cheaper than most bars.  The place is chill, people are super cool (no hipsters) and they don't mind if you come in with that bacon wrapped hot dog you just bought on the corner.  Real dogs are welcome too.
author: P D.

description: The coldest draft beer in town and only $2 for a PBR.  Mission bar I think I love you.
author: dan d.

description:
the laws of supply and demand have pushed this 4 star bar to 3.

cash only also puts a ding in the rating.

i didn't spend too long here though, one of our friends left his ID so i downed my 2 drinks and jet. perhaps i'll be back.
author: Ameer N.

description:
background:
we went on a taqueria pub crawl for a friend's going away party.  apparently there are no taquerias or pubs in nyc.  ;)  during the night, we hit up (1) el farolito, (2) mission bar, (3) taqueria cancun, and lastly (4) zeitgeist, where (5) the tamale lady showed up.

review:
i really have no legitimacy when it comes to reviewing bars since i dont like going to them.  but i feel obligated to review it since it was part of the taqueria pub crawl.  i'll just write down some thoughts, hopefully something in there is useful.

unfriendly bartender and staff
delicious lemon drop shot
the nudie video game near the front was pretty fun
author: jing c.

description:
all the people who like to hang out on valenica nears the teens, stay away. don't ruin this fine establishment with your too-cool-for-school attitude and hipster flare. 

this is one of the only few bars i've been to in SF that just feel like a bar. no frills, nothing fancy. comfy pleather red lounge booths, plenty of bar seating, and great service. 

if you do decide to come however, please check your attitude at the door. and if you took a cab to get there, you probably want to pop right back in and head back where came from.
author: Mike Skinz Z.

description: Nothing like walking off the bus and into a tanq & tonic.  The thing about townie bars, is that you never feel out of place getting drunk while the sun is up.  Cheap drinks, sticky bar, good tenders.  What more?
author: Nelson A.

description: Has replaced the Napper Tandy as my most preferred office bar (due to cleanliness and price).  This place has cheap beer and cheap drinks (PBR is the way to go here).  Great Jukebox and a pool table that's often open. Not a place to meet people, but a great bar to bring a group to. Great Great Bar Action going down here kids.
author: Tyler W.

description:
Come on now, You know this place is the shit. I work around the corner (the Velvet Cantina) and I run over have a shot with the staff and run back to my bar and serve my patrons. What is not to like.

My favorite story about Mission bar was the night that My Aunt was in town and me and my sister took her out to Teatro Zinzane (sp?!) and I was dressed up in a nice shirt and a blazer (fuck it was family for Christ sake plus I clean up well) and not wearing my usual jeans and t-shirt. And some fucker started talking shit like I was some Medjool  overflow asshole. Of course after four shots of tequila (necessary after a night with family) I was not going to have my honor insulted by some skinny bike messenger and and his little friend. I told him I had some family function that night and I was not some wannabe at the bar trying to steal his girl (I was by the way). So he proceeded to say something else smart then the I Irish Catholic in me kicked in and I got in his face. He attempted something that was supposed to be a shove and when I shoved him on his ass I think that he got the pic that I outweighed him by at least twenty pounds and I could pound him into submission and sell it to Kink.com

But you got love a bar where you go to all the time and some punk tries to get in your face cause you look like you don't belong. Not bad skinny punk, just watch who you try and push around. But you should always stand up for the integrity of your water hole.

God, I love that bar!
author: Peter S.

description: Mission Bar is the only reason I miss living in the Mission, and I miss it a lot. Laura, Walter, Tommy, Gabe and Bubba are the best.
author: Max S.

description: Perfect bar to hang out and have a good conversation. I live in Oakland, but Mission Bar is easy to get to because it's right near the 24th Bart stop. All that and $2,50 happy hour pints. Viva la Mission Bar!
author: Steve O.

description: I tried to enter with a bag of merchandise that did include a capped beer along with food.  I was told I was unable to enter without checking the contents of my bag.   I told the bouncer that I did have a beer in the bag but had NO intention of opening in the establishment.  My girlfriend and I wanted to have a stronger night cap before bed.   We were met with no hospitality!  Bottom line is if you have a thug at the door you might want to condition him to understand the workings of a bar business.  I left with no argument but will NEVER go back.   I'm a ration person who can deal with understandable rules.  THIS IS A BOUNCER WHO DOESN'T CARE ABOUT THE SUCCESS OF THE ESTABLISHMENT.  HE SEEMS TO ENJOY THE POWER AT THE DOOR.   MY SUGGESTION IS TO DUMP HIM AS HE BRINGS NO CREDIT OR VALUE TO THE BUSINESS.
author: damon t.

description: great staff, some scary patrons. Good cheap drinks. Go with friends, you'll have an a OK time.
author: Rachel L.

description: I went here last night with a few Flickr friends.  It's a cool chill dive bar with good music.  They make good drinks and are pretty cheap too.  Recommended if you're in the area.
author: Mitch A.

description: Nice thing about coming back to America is that, if you're with your buddy chatting about some specific topic, some guy sitting next to you will chime in and be able to converse with you. This happened to me at Mission Bar, when my friend and I were chatting about some aspect of music technology. This exchange would never have happened in my last domicile (in Prague, where people generally keep to their own). Anyways, seemed like a nice place for a drink in the Mission, with a mixture of different types (locals, wannabes, hippies, techies) inhabiting the different nooks and crannies. I wouldn't dare get near the pool table though, those regulars seemed rather intenzzzzz.
author: Hubert H.

description: Great neighborhood bar. Never too crowded, not even on the weekends, no Marina and not overrun by hipsters either. The crowd there is pretty much always pleasant, the bartenders are cool (don't listen to the naysayers, I've always been served well), the juke box is great, and the owner is absolutely fabulous. You rock, Laura!
author: Alex J.

description: I needed a local dive bar when I moved to the mission, and what could be better than walking to the corner and seeing in bright red letters "BAR". This place isn't just about convenience. It's chill, cheap, and the drinks are strong. What could a girl who likes beer ask for?
author: Susan L.

description: Lotta...enough said. Ok, she's no longer working there. But the rest of the bar staff are awesome too! yesterday we celebrated our friend's final day working across the street, which included part two from Sat night....ouch. There was much sex, drugs and rock & roll going on for a Sunday afternoon.
author: Colleen B.

description: I went here for my last night out in SF before I start a new job. I liked it. The drinks were cheap and you didn't have to wait long to get your hands on them. I wouldn't say the place is a dive though, maybe my standards are low. More of a neighborhood bar. Actually, I'd just say it is a great bar where I can hang out with friends.
author: Arun C.

description: I once moved to a new apartment just to be closer to Mission Bar (or just plain "BAR," as I have always called it).  It was truly my second home.  Amazing jukebox, cheap-ass drinks (including PBR pitchers!!!), amazing bartenders ('specially Laura and Walter).  Many people describe the patrons as "scary" or "ancient alcoholics," which is exactly what I'm looking for when I walk into a bar.  Gawd, I miss this place!
author: Polly Enmity P.

description: We came here to meet up with more friends after a Noise Pop show at 12 Galaxies a block over.  I was taken over by the friendly bar staff, the unpretentious and laid-back crowd and ambience.  The pool table was nicely tucked away in the back of the room.  The reddish light and decor exude the warmth and homy feel that you don't always get in hip bars.
author: Tiffany L.

description: For some reason I always have to do a lot of convincing to get my friends to agree to go here and I don't know why. This IS one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. Non pretention, a good jukebox and people always join in when dancing to the music. Good dive bars are for me.
author: Erin O.

description:
oh mission bar, i have had so many good times with you. you know how i like my drinks, stiff and cheap!!

no bullshit, great bartenders, awesome vibe.
author: cristina s.

description: I've actually enjoyed this bar more than other ones in the Mission. Sure it's a little douche-y but overall, not a bad crowd when it gets packed. They have cheap beer and a proper jukebox. It gets packed on Fridays and Saturdays so get there early to grab a seat. I like it because it looks like a dive but isn't really.
author: Gina R.

description:
bar is awesome.

did you know it has a back bar?  yah, it's in a secret location.  i wish they would open it up more frequently.
author: Michael M.

description: Good prices.  Speedy service for a weekend.  Cool Halloween decor.  Not too loud.  I'm going back.
author: Dan C.

description:
i have spent MANY nights getting drunker here! yes, drunk-ER!

drinks are cheap, its usually pretty uncrowded, music is good, and there always seems to be some random couple in the back making out. huh?!

the atmosphere is chill, and yah, it does seem like theres tons of regulars.
author: Ameigh F.

description: Love ya Walter (muah)....get past the facade of a big, tough guy, and you'll love him too!  $3 Tecates and El Faralito a block away. Am I in heaven?
author: Laurie A.

description: Had my birthday here and it was fabulous.  The simplest of dive bars.  The owner Laura is awesome and super laid back.  They have a random but amazing jukebox...ranging from Johnny Cash to Prince to the Humpty Dance.  My favorite go-to place for neighborhood drinks.
author: Dolores Y.

description: There's nothing i can say to justify Mission Bar. It's just a great dive. I never go there anymore since i moved, but nothing but fond memories.
author: Jordan B.

description:
Loves it!
Super-cheap drinks, tacky decor and mission grime.
author: pauline e.

description: This place is just what it says...  BAR.  That's why I think I'm kinda in love!  Fun and skilled bartenders.  Good tunes.  Always a seat available.  Just the right amount of grime, without a thick stentch in the air.  Entertaining every time...  there's always some local from the block doing something crazy or silly in a drunken stupor, making you feel less drunk that you thought you were...  but as soon as you leave and get back to your own reality you realize how great your strong and affordable cocktails were...  stumble, stumble, slur, cab pulls up and you pour yourself into it...  mission accomplished!
author: Erica S.

description: Last night was my first time there.  I'd never really considered going there (not sure why), even though I live close by, but some friends suggested we go.  It was a Wednesday night, and there were 4 people there, including the bartender.  So, I can't say much about the crowd.  But, it seemed like a good layout, and the pool was fun, and the beer was cold.
author: Chadwick W.

description: Cheap drinks! I paid just $3.25 for a Maker's on the rocks at 7pm, and in the soak-the-hipsters Mission, that is a beautiful thing. (Okay, it went up to $5 after 8pm, but I can still live with that.) Also, the bartender had really fine tattoos. And I got to hang out with some fine friends, and then stagger down the street to El Farolito for a burrito to soak it all up. If this place was closer to where I live, I would make it my local.
author: Fawn F.

description: Sucks i couldnt yelp this place when i worked in the mission only half a block away.....took it for granted...i did. Time doesnt exist here. Got drunk with the bar keep and a good buddy, first and last time i had wild turkey. This place makes the strongest mixed drinks for a fraction of what they should be charging.
author: Joe J.

description:
The only reason this place looses a star is because I never have a good time there and the guy bartender always rips my friend off. (consistently overcharging him)

But the GOOD:
-Great priced drinks, I recommend liquor over beer here
-Beautiful lady Bartender 

Bad:
-Unfortunately guys usually outnumber the girl 8:1 here
author: Henry C.

description: I have always liked this place.  During baseball season they have the Giant's game on and the bartenders get into it.  They have cheap beer, a pretty good jukebox, nice bartenders. It used to be nicely crowded on the weekends, now it can get a bit intense.  I went there last night in search of good cheap beer and pool and...FOUND IT! Even parted with a dollar for the jukebox I was so happy.
author: rachel h.

description: Huge Drinks, Beautiful Women, Killin' juke box, I would suffice to say it's the longest bar in the city.  Nice people, excellent bartenders, and friendly regulars.   The highlight is all of the memorabilia such as boxing gloves, old boxing posters, occasional posters of Walter the bartender, and beatiful knick knacks
author: Zach H.

description: This is the dive bar for me.   Great juke box. Nice mix a customers. Reasonable prices.  Smoking not allowed (unlike many dives in this part of the mission)  Great staff, love me some laura and walter.  No lame ass uberhipsters, if your looking for uberhipsters and want to observe them in there natarual habitat go to the phonebooth on South Van Ness and 25th.  The space is pretty large and while busy on weekends its always comfortable.
author: Jimmy M.

description: i can pretty much ditto what i wrote about docs clock. they're both in the same area. mission bar is a little more divey. their jukebox has a lot of good stuff - including gnr appetite for destruction, which is always a crowd pleaser for drunk idiots. they also have a pool table. can't say anything wonderful or horrible about this place. it is what it is. i've had some fun times here with friends. drinks are also stiff and cheap.
author: James J.

description: this is the place you go with people that you want to get drunk and make out with in public but not be seen by anybody you know.  Their drinks are really cheap and they usually are playing good rock and punk and classics on the jukebox and there are lots of ratty vinyl booths and the lighting is dim.  Also the bartenders are nice.
author: Cody R.

description: i love this place,its another one for the "why don't i come here more often" file. big ass bar,good music,pool table.cuteish dudes and at this point cuteish ILL TAKE. nice bar staff.decent prices
author: Lauren V.

description: my good friend and elite yelper maria d. took me here during my first visit to SF. it was awesome. just how i like my bars -- divey and full of alcoholics. i think i drank things that had pineapple juice in them but i can't remember. when i woke up the next morning for my early-morning flight out of sfo, i was still buzzed -- now that's quality!
author: Laura A.

description: everyone i was with enjoyed their uber cheap drinks and each other's company.  good place and good soundtrack!
author: Jill k.

description: $7 for a ketel one/soda AND a PBR?  my god is that even ketel one in that drink? since my friend didnt immediately gag after she drank her ketel one/soda, i have to say close enough.  the mission bar rocks for its divey-ness. and it lets adorable dogs into the bar and lets them sit on the bar stools.  lot of good bars to choose from in this area but major bonus points for also being 1 block away from el farlito (nachos at 2 am = heaven).
author: Cathy L.

description: this is a great place to go for a late night whiskey during the week, but oh good lord it is hell on weekends.
author: Lily S.

description: good bar for people who like sitting at the bar.  other than that typical dive with nice dark lighting and cheap beer.
author: Markus B.

description: Seriously, don't go there if you haven't got a californian I.D. They won't let you in. They're superstrict on the id and I've ruined many nights by going there. There's always one of your friends that will be denied.
author: William L.
